content: Hi- this may be an odd request.. :) I am creating an "Imaging AI in Practice (IAIP)" video for RSNA. I am trying to "advertise" (inform? educate?) for FHIRcast. Is there a high res logo file that I could get? (soon) Otherwise, I will try to get a screen snapshot off of the webpage. If you haven't seen the vIAIP videos from last year, I think they are pretty darn good, although I may be bias. Thanks.

Hey @Teri M Sippel Schmidt , FHIRcast doesn't have a good logo. I've tried a few times to change that. This conversation just prompted me to try again. For branding, I usually use the color and spelling on this deck's title page: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Rbw8QxYUg_l3db9S2eeCc96d9gvrMLlEzYdu7UYl2E8/edit#slide=id.g6009b6c328_0_0

Thanks, @Isaac Vetter ! I hate to go all corporate on you, but just to be clear, the orange color on the title page is part of the FHIRcast branding? (and, yes, a bit of logo work might be good, lol. I should put a student onto this task... :) ).
it is a HL7 work. the HL7 brand is the one that matters
I hear you, John, except the most successful HL7 projects also have their own logo ... starting with FHIR itself, but also SMART, CDS Hooks. All the accelerators, except for Argonaut.

@Teri M Sippel Schmidt, yes. I use that orange (specifically #f46524) for FHIRcast. Overall, FHIRcast branding is immature. I submitted a logo creation job on fiverr.com this morning. We'll see if it results in anything useful.
Got it. Thanks, Isaac and John. @John Moehrke - no worries. Trust me, I have HL7, FHIR, DICOM, and IHE logos splattered everywhere at RSNA 2021. :) I'm not a graphics person, but trying... promise!

I agree with Isaac. FHIR is part of HL7 and certainly has its own branding. The success of FHIR and many subgroups is dependent on many factors but breaking the stodgy standards branding mold is huge to expanding the conversation to new audiences
@Teri M Sippel Schmidt, all FHIRcast folk -- how do you like this: FHIRcast-01.jpg ?
@John Moehrke - I had this created on fiverr.com and own the full rights to the image. Do you have suggestions for declaring / transferring these rights to HL7?
github issue to track need to create/deploy .favicon & logos -- https://github.com/HL7/fhircast-docs/issues/367
